TopicTitle: Changing biulding ship from VAB to SPH and simmetry

Articles.Content: Hi, when I start building a vessel in VAB and i later want to redesign it and add wings in SPH, i cant never add them with perfect simmetry, no matter is I press "R" or whatever... Am i doing something wrong or its just it cant be done?

2 hours ago, juvilado said:

Hi, when I start building a vessel in VAB and i later want to redesign it and add wings in SPH, i cant never add them with perfect simmetry, no matter is I press "R" or whatever... Am i doing something wrong or its just it cant be done?

Try pressing C.

^this, to toggle snap mode. Combine with shift for precision mode. 

Also, try F to toggle symmetry from vessel to parent part or vice versa.

More here http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Key_bindings

It should also be mentioned that parts cannot have symmetry different from their parent parts (other than having no symmetry at all). So if you place parts with radial symmetry in the VAB you won't be able to use mirror symmetry on any parts attached to them later, whether in the VAB or SPH.

thanks to all. its all what i was thinking... that leads to a suggestion: I think we should be able to change any simmetry regardless of where we are building our next vessel, it is so logical, i can't imagine how developpers didnt make it already. what do you think about? Endorse me!!! :-)
